summary_text: AWS Certified professional with [certification name] credential. Expertise in cloud architecture, migration, and optimization. Hands-on experience deploying and managing production workloads on AWS.
hard_skills: AWS Services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, etc.)
common_mistakes: Listing certification without practical experience, not mentioning specific AWS services used, missing cost optimization achievements, or outdated certification.
seo_title: Resume Format for AWS Certified Professionals (2026) | Free Template
meta_description: Best resume for AWS certified professionals. Highlight Solutions Architect, DevOps, Developer certifications. Salary ₹8L-₹28L. ATS-optimized template India.

faqs.q: Which AWS certification is most valuable in India?
faqs.a: AWS Solutions Architect Associate is most popular. For DevOps: DevOps Engineer Professional. For developers: Developer Associate. All boost salary 20-30%.

faqs.q: Should I list expired AWS certifications?
faqs.a: Yes, but mention expiry date. AWS certs expire after 3 years. Recertify or mention 'Previously Certified' with year.

faqs.q: How do I showcase AWS certification on resume?
faqs.a: Create dedicated 'Certifications' section near top. Include: certification full name, credential ID, issue date, and AWS badge link if possible.

industry_context: AWS dominates cloud in India. Certified professionals earn 25-40% more. High demand in startups, product companies, and enterprises migrating to cloud.
ats_tips: Mention exact certification name (e.g., AWS Solutions Architect Associate)
List specific AWS services used in projects
Quantify cost savings or performance improvements

summary_text: PMP certified Project Manager with [X] years managing complex IT/infrastructure projects. Expertise in PMI methodologies, stakeholder management, and team leadership. Successfully delivered projects worth ₹[X] Cr on time and within budget.
common_mistakes: Listing PMP without showcasing managed projects, missing quantifiable outcomes (budget, team size, timelines), or not mentioning PDUs (Professional Development Units).
seo_title: Resume Format for PMP Certified Project Managers (2026) | Free Template
meta_description: Best resume for PMP certified Project Managers. Highlight PMI certification, IT projects, stakeholder management. Salary in India ₹12L-₹35L. ATS template.

faqs.q: How much salary increase does PMP give?
faqs.a: PMP increases salary by 20-30% in India. Average PMP-certified PM earns ₹15L-₹25L vs ₹10L-₹18L for non-certified. Big companies (TCS, Infosys) value PMP.

faqs.q: Where should I put PMP on my resume?
faqs.a: Add 'PMP' right after your name (e.g., 'John Doe, PMP'). Also create 'Certifications' section with PMP ID number and validity date.

faqs.q: Do I need to maintain PMP PDUs?
faqs.a: Yes! PMP requires 60 PDUs every 3 years. Mention active certification status and recent PDU activities to show commitment to learning.

industry_context: PMP is gold standard for project management in India. MNCs, consulting firms, and large enterprises (L&T, TCS, Accenture) highly value PMP certified professionals.
ats_tips: Include PMP ID and certification date
Quantify project outcomes (budget, team size, timeline)

summary_text: CA Finalist with [attempts] who completed articleship from [firm name]. Strong foundation in auditing, taxation, and financial reporting. Seeking position in audit, tax, or finance function while preparing for final attempt.
common_mistakes: Not mentioning attempt details transparently, missing articleship achievements, not highlighting specific audit/tax expertise, or defensive about not clearing yet.
seo_title: Resume Format for CA Final Appeared/Finalist (2026) | Free Template
meta_description: Best resume for CA Finalist/Final Appeared candidates. Highlight articleship, audit, taxation skills. Salary ₹4L-₹10L. Get ATS-optimized template for India.

faqs.q: Should I mention how many attempts for CA Final?
faqs.a: Be honest. Mention 'CA Final - [Month Year] Attempt' or 'Appeared in CA Final'. Companies appreciate transparency. Focus on articleship learnings.

faqs.q: What if I've decided not to pursue CA anymore?
faqs.a: Mention 'CA Final Appeared' or 'CA Inter Qualified' and move on. Highlight articleship experience instead. Many successful finance professionals are CA dropouts.

faqs.q: Can I get jobs without completing CA?
faqs.a: Yes! Mid-tier companies and startups hire CA Finalists for accounts, audit, tax roles. Salary: ₹4L-₹10L. Leverage articleship experience.

faqs.q: Should I continue working while preparing for CA Final?
faqs.a: Many do. Seek flexible roles or companies that support CA preparation. Mention this requirement upfront to avoid later conflicts.

industry_context: CA Final has 30-40% pass rate. Many take 2-3 attempts. Companies understand this and hire finalists for valuable articleship experience, especially in auditing and taxation.

summary_text: Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) with expertise in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and security auditing. Hands-on experience identifying and mitigating security threats for enterprises and government clients.
common_mistakes: Not mentioning hands-on pentesting experience, missing security tools expertise, no bounty/CVE discoveries mentioned, or outdated CEH certification.
seo_title: Resume Format for Certified Ethical Hacker CEH (2026) | Free Template
meta_description: Best resume for CEH certified ethical hackers. Highlight pentesting, security tools, OWASP. Salary ₹6L-₹20L in India. ATS-optimized cybersecurity template.

faqs.q: Is CEH certification enough for cybersecurity jobs?
faqs.a: CEH is great start but pair with hands-on skills. Companies value pentesting experience, CTF participation, or bug bounty finds more than just certification.

faqs.q: What's the salary for CEH certified professionals in India?
faqs.a: ₹6L-₹20L based on experience. Fresh CEH: ₹4L-₹8L. With 3-5 years pentesting: ₹10L-₹20L. BFSI and government sectors pay well.

faqs.q: Should I mention bug bounties on resume?
faqs.a: Absolutely! Mention platform (HackerOne, Bugcrowd), companies whose bugs you found, and bounty amounts if significant. Shows real-world skills.

industry_context: Cybersecurity demand is exploding in India. Government mandate for security audits driving growth. Banks, fintech, and IT companies hiring aggressively. CEH recognized globally.
ats_tips: Include bug bounties or CVEs discovered

summary_text: Certified Scrum Master (CSM) with [X] years facilitating agile teams. Expertise in sprint planning, backlog management, and removing impediments. Successfully led teams of [X] members delivering [X] products/projects.
common_mistakes: Confusing Scrum Master with Project Manager, not demonstrating servant leadership, missing metrics (velocity, sprint success rate), or not showcasing team growth.
seo_title: Resume Format for Certified Scrum Master CSM (2026) | Free Template
meta_description: Best resume for Certified Scrum Master. Highlight agile, sprint facilitation, team coaching. Salary ₹8L-₹22L in India. ATS-optimized CSM template.

faqs.q: What's the difference between Scrum Master and Project Manager?
faqs.a: Scrum Master: Servant leader, facilitates team, removes impediments, no direct authority. Project Manager: Manages scope/budget/timeline, has authority. Very different roles!

faqs.q: Do I need coding knowledge as Scrum Master?
faqs.a: Not mandatory but technical background helps in understanding team challenges. Many Scrum Masters come from development/testing background.

faqs.q: What's the salary for Scrum Masters in India?
faqs.a: ₹8L-₹22L based on experience. Junior SM: ₹6L-₹10L. Senior/Agile Coach: ₹15L-₹25L. Product companies pay more than service companies.

industry_context: Agile adoption growing rapidly in India. Product companies, startups, and progressive service companies hiring Scrum Masters. CSM certification is baseline, experience matters more.
ats_tips: Include team size and velocity metrics
